Subject: 300-0377210-2023 // Robin Wilder-Hamilton - PIP
To: jessa@whaleylawfirm.com 
Cc: KentuckyPIP.Clm 

Good afternoon,

I am reaching out in regard to the PIP claim for your client, Robin
Wilder-Hamilton, filed as a result of the accident that occurred on
6/15/2023.

A review of the file indicates we have not received completed PIP forms or
any medical bills/complete medical records for your client. Please have
your client complete and return the Application for Benefits and medical
authorization forms. The attending physician’s report should be completed
by the treating provider(s) and returned to our office. If your client is
seeking reimbursement of lost wages, the Wage and Salary Verification form
needs to be completed by the employer and returned with a copy of the dated
doctor’s statement(s) placing your client off of work.

Additionally, we have received the attached VA Lien, which appears to be
for ER charges on 6/17/2023. In addition to the complete medical records,
as these are technically hospital charges, we would need updated direction
from your office to be able to review for payment under the PIP.

Finally, please provide an update on your client’s current treatment status
as it relates to the 6/15/2023 accident.

Sincerely,

*Sarah Lickliter *AINS, AIC-M, SCLA

KY Regional PIP

Case: Robin-Wilder-Hamilton-MVA-6-15-2023. Client: Robin Wilder Hamilton.

On June 11, 2024, a PIP claim channel was opened regarding Robin Wilder-Hamilton’s claim 300-0377210-2023. Donald Thomas, a Claim Representative in the PIP Response Team, sent an email to Jessa Galosmo at Whaley Law Firm (jessa@whaleylawfirm.com) to indicate that he was temporarily handling the PIP portion of Robin Wilder-Hamilton’s PIP claim. He asked Jessa to forward any bills her office had received for Robin, noting that Auto-Owners Insurance had not received any bills to date. He also requested to be advised whether Robin continues to treat for injuries sustained in the 06/15/2023 motor vehicle accident.

Thomas asked, when possible, for guidance on whether the claim should continue to be handled in accordance with the direction of benefits on file. The direction currently on file reserves $4,000.00 in benefits to be decided later how to disburse, and uses $6,000.00 for bills as they come, excluding any hospital-related bills. He also requested that Robin complete and return the attached PIP forms. The email was signed by Donald Thomas, Claim Representative for the PIP Response Team, and provided his contact information: p: 517.323.1550 ext. 51881, Hours: 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. EST.

This message was forwarded by Jessa on the same day to Robin Wilder Hamilton at the MVA filevine address RobinWilderHamiltonMVAZ3849886@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com, with the subject “Robin Wilder-Hamilton - Claim 300-0377210-2023 - Updated Direction.” The forwarded message included the original content from Donald Thomas dated June 11, 2024, and concluded with a closing from Jessa Galosmo at Whaley Law Firm, including her contact information: Ph: (502)357-9975, Fax: (502)364-9363. The email also referenced an inline image attachment (image002.png) in the signature area. The case involves a motor vehicle accident occurring on 06/15/2023.

episodes.natural_language:
Case: Robin-Wilder-Hamilton-MVA-6-15-2023. Client: Robin Wilder Hamilton.

In the motor vehicle accident file dated June 15, 2023, related communications show that on June 21, 2024 at 08:30:40 -0400, Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm forwarded a PIP (Personal Injury Protection) Application form to Robin Wilder Hamilton via his Filevine project email address, with the subject line “Fwd: PIP Application form.”

The forwarded thread includes a reply from Robin Wilder dated Friday, June 21, 2024, at 12:03?AM, with the subject “Re: PIP Application form,” addressed to Jessa Galosmo. In his reply, he stated that he cannot fill out the physician form, and noted that care was provided at the Lexington VA hospital on that Saturday, three days after the accident. He explained that he retired from the military the year before, but he had been doing DoorDash, using his 2006 Seabring convertible for that work. Because this was self-employment, he did not know how to fill out the employment form. He also stated he would send a copy of his insurance card from that time, plus the agreement for the car. The message line includes the line “Yahoo Mail: Search, Organize, Conquer.”

Earlier in the thread, on Tuesday, June 11, 2024 at 4:38 PM, Jessa Galosmo had written to Robin: “Hi Robin, Please complete the forms and return it to us once done.” The message closes with Jessa’s signature block: “All the best, Jessa Galosmo Whaley Law Firm Ph: (502)357-9975 Fax: (502)364-9363,” a block that appears twice in the forwarded content.

On July 19, 2024, at approximately 3:40 PM, Jessa Galosmo of Whaley Law Firm forwarded an email titled “Robin Wilder-Hamilton 300-0377210-2023 - PIP Pay log and Treatment Update Request” to Justin Chumbley and Jessica Bottorff. The forwarded message contains a response from Donald Thomas, a PIP Claim Representative with the PIP Response Team, to Jessa Galosmo.

Thomas’ email, dated July 19, 2024 (approximately 1:38 PM), referred to the July 10, 2024 directive to pay a VA lien in the amount of $4,437.13 for date of service 06/17/2023 and to a billing statement from Scioto Valley Chiropractic and Rehab Center for dates 02/01/2024 through 03/27/2024. He stated that he has issued payment to the Department of Veterans Affairs and attached a PIP pay log showing this payment.

Regarding the treatment sought at Scioto Valley Chiropractic and Rehab Center, the records for 02/01/2024 indicate that the treatment was related to a condition the client experienced years prior, and that due to multiple medical conditions and being in the Army, the condition had worsened a month prior for no apparent reason. Based on this information, the chiropractic treatment appears unrelated to injuries sustained in the 06/15/2023 motor vehicle accident. If the provider believes the treatment is related to injuries from the 06/15/2023 accident, additional documentation indicating relatedness should be provided for further consideration.

Thomas also requested that, when able, the recipient advise whether Robin Wilder-Hamilton continues to treat for injuries sustained in the 06/15/2023 motor vehicle accident, and to have Ms. Wilder-Hamilton complete and return the forms previously provided.

The message closed with thanks and the signature of Donald Thomas, Claim Representative, PIP Response Team, including contact information: p: 517.323.1550 ext. 51881 and hours from 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. EST.

The email from Jessa Galosmo, in Whaley Law Firm, followed with her sign-off and contact details: Ph: (502)357-9975 and Fax: (502)364-9363. An image attachment reference (image002.png) was included in the message.

This note documents a forwarded email thread related to Robin Wilder Hamilton’s motor vehicle accident case that occurred on June 15, 2023. The forward is titled “Fwd: 596-W-20231106-115744/GCL #537467/Wilder-Hamilton” and originates from Jessica Bottorff of Whaley Law Firm, sent on Friday, October 4, 2024, at 11:04:15 AM Eastern Time, to Robin Wilder Hamilton’s MVA project email address in Filevine.

The forwarded message contains a reply dated October 4, 2024, from Louise M. Stevenson, a Paralegal Specialist with the Department of Veterans Affairs Office of General Counsel, Revenue Law Group. Stevenson informs that the VA’s claim balance for Robin Wilder-Hamilton (date of injury or DOI: June 15, 2023) is zero. Auto-Owners paid the claim, and the payment was posted on August 20, 2024. The case has been closed. Regarding medical records, Stevenson notes that the Revenue Law Group does not provide medical records; if records are needed, they must be requested from the Lexington veteran’s VA Medical Center Release of Information at 1101 Veterans Drive, Lexington, KY 40502.

Stevenson provides her contact information: Louise M. Stevenson, Paralegal Specialist, Department of Veterans Affairs, Office of General Counsel, Revenue Law Group. Case assignments listed include Lexington, Louisville, Mountain Home, New Orleans; Mass Litigation. Her phone number is (317) 361-6278; fax is (202) 495-5041; hours are Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Her email is Louise.Stevenson@va.gov. She adds a reminder: unless using secured or encrypted mail, do not include veteran PII in emails or email documents that contain PII, and to reference the GCLAWS number associated with the case in the email subject line and correspondence when referring to the client.

Stevenson’s message is labeled as privileged and confidential, intended only for the addressees, with instructions to notify her and delete the message if received in error, and a prohibition on dissemination, distribution, or copying. If received in error, the recipient should call the listed number and return the message via U.S. Postal Service.

Stevenson also includes several procedural resources: for new third-party billing requests, information on the VA Federal Medical Care Recovery Program and how to request medical bills and records can be found at the VA’s collections website (https://www.va.gov/ogc/collections.asp); for NEW CHAMP VA billing requests, to send requests to VHA Community Care, P.O. Box 469062 741/04, Denver, CO 80246-9062 (fax 303/398-5116). She notes that veterans can access and download their own health records at https://www.myhealth.va.gov/mhv-portal-web/web/myhealthevet/download-your-own-va-medical-records, and directs readers to VA resources at https://www.vets.gov/.

The message ends with a prompt: HOW WAS OUR SERVICE TODAY? and a note that fax numbers have changed; readers are instructed to verify on the VA’s public website to ensure they are using the correct fax number: https://www.va.gov/ogc/collections.asp. A further note references “VA Subrogation – Request VA Medical Bills” and again reiterates that fax numbers have changed.

The forward also includes the initial email from Jessica Bottorff, sent Wednesday, October 2, 2024, at 8:33 AM, to Louise Stevenson and CC’d to the Robin Wilder Hamilton MVA 6/15/2023 Filevine project email address (RobinWilderHamiltonMVAZ3849886@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com), with the subject “[EXTERNAL] 596-W-20231106-115744/GCL #537467/Wilder-Hamilton.” In this message, Bottorff asks, “Good morning, just wanted to check the status of our request for updated records and bills on our client, Robin Wilder Hamilton. Thanks!” The note is signed by Jessica Bottorff of Whaley Law Firm, located at 712 Lyndon Lane, Louisville, KY 40222, with fax number (502) 364-9363.

In summary, the October 2024 correspondence confirms that the VA claim balance for Robin Wilder Hamilton, tied to the June 15, 2023 injury, is zero, that Auto-Owners paid the claim with a payment posted on August 20, 2024, and that the case is closed. It also communicates that medical records are not provided by Revenue Law Group and details the process and contact information for obtaining such records, along with related billing and records resources, and includes the prior inquiry sent by the law firm requesting updated records and bills.

episodes.natural_language:
The case titled Robin Wilder Hamilton, regarding a motor vehicle accident on June 15, 2023 (DOI 6/15/2023), is documented in the file named Robin-Wilder-Hamilton-MVA-6-15-2023, with the internal reference 596-W-20231106-115744/GCL #537467/Wilder-Hamilton. A forwarded email thread dated October 4, 2024 shows ongoing involvement with the Department of Veterans Affairs’ Office of General Counsel (Revenue Law Group) as it relates to VA-related recoveries.

In the forwarded message, Louise M. Stevenson, a Paralegal Specialist with the VA Office of General Counsel, advised Jessica Bottorff that the VA case was closed on August 20, 2024, at which time a payment was issued to the VA. Stevenson stated that if more VA treatment is to be included in the case, a list of the dates to be included should be provided so she can request that the case be reopened if needed. For the time being, the case would remain closed unless related dates were provided for billing.

The communication also notes that the VA claim was sent to the office on February 22, 2024. An eFax transmission record shows the claim was delivered successfully: Job/Fax ID 06c170bb-b740-43e8-b903-5d3a419f6f34, originating fax 14809071910, destination fax 15023649363, duration 436 seconds, 11 pages, with the subject line “Claim Asserted - ATTY - Wilder-Hamilton.” The claim was submitted on February 22, 2024 at 11:58:06 EST and delivered at 12:06:23 EST.

Prior to these notes, Jessica Bottorff responded on October 4, 2024 that the office had received a bill, but the updated request was seeking anything beyond the date of service. Specifically, she asked whether there were any additional bills past the June 17, 2023 date of service.

In an earlier Oct. 4, 2024 message, Stevenson informed Bottorff that the VA claim balance regarding Robin Wilder-Hamilton (DOI 6/15/2023) was zero because Auto-Owners had paid the claim and the payment was posted on August 20, 2024. The case was therefore closed. Stevenson noted that the Revenue Law Group does not provide medical records; if medical records were needed, they must be requested from the Lexington VA Medical Center Business Office Release of Information at 1101 Veterans Drive, Lexington, KY 40502.

The email signatures repeatedly remind recipients to avoid sending PII via unsecured email, referencing the GCLAWS number for the case and advising secure handling of information. They also include notices about updated VA fax numbers, and links to VA resources such as the VA’s collections page, the My Health web portal for downloading records, and general veterans resources. The subject matter references that new third-party billing requests should follow VA guidelines, and new CHAMPVA billing requests should be directed to the VHA Community Care address. The communication stresses that the VA Subrogation process and medical bill requests require using the appropriate channels, and notes that veterans can access and download their own health records.

Within these communications, the case assignments listed by the VA Office of General Counsel include Lexington, Louisville, Mountain Home, and New Orleans, with mass litigation also noted.

episodes.natural_language:
In the case of Robin Wilder Hamilton (Case: Robin-Wilder-Hamilton-MVA-6-15-2023; Client: Robin Wilder Hamilton), the Revenue Law Group handled a VA subrogation matter connected to a motor vehicle accident that occurred on June 15, 2023. The file reference is 596-W-20231106-115744/GCL #537467/Wilder-Hamilton. In October 2024, a series of email exchanges took place between Jessica Bottorff of Whaley Law Firm and Louise Stevenson, a Paralegal Specialist with the Department of Veterans Affairs Office of General Counsel (Revenue Law Group), regarding the VA claim and related billing.

On October 4, 2024, Stevenson informed Jessica that the VA claim balance for Robin Wilder-Hamilton (DOI: 6/15/2023) was zero and that Auto-Owners had paid the claim, with payment posted on August 20, 2024, after which the case was closed. Stevenson noted that the Revenue Law Group does not provide medical records and, if medical records were needed, they would have to be requested from the Lexington VA facility at VA Medical Center, Business Office, Release of Information, 1101 Veterans Drive, Lexington, KY 40502. Stevenson also provided broad contact details for the VA Office of General Counsel and emphasized several procedural points, including the updated fax numbers on the VA’s public website and references to the VA’s collections program for third-party billing. She included standard confidentiality notices and reminders to reference the GCLAWS number in correspondence, along with guidance on secure communications, and she listed VA resources such as myhealth.va.gov and vets.gov. Stevenson also included directions for new third-party billing requests and ChampVA billing, including the address for ChampVA submissions (VHA Community Care, P.O. Box 469062 741/04, Denver, CO 80246-9062; Fax 303/398-5116). Affected recipients were reminded that veterans can download and access their own health records.

Later that same day, at 10:57 AM, Stevenson reiterated that the VA claim balance for Robin Wilder-Hamilton was zero and that Auto-Owners’ payment posted on 8/20/2024, resulting in a closed case. She again stated that the Revenue Law Group does not provide medical records and directed Jessica to request records from the Lexington VA Medical Center Release of Information at the address above. Stevenson also reiterated the confidentiality and security reminders, and again provided links for VA resources and instructions regarding third-party billing and ChampVA.

At 11:37 AM on October 4, 2024, Jessica Bottorff followed up with Stevenson, thanking her for the medical records information and requesting a copy of the bill itself. Stevenson’s earlier message did not include a bill copy, and Jessica requested it for the Wilder-Hamilton file.

Later, at 2:04 PM on October 4, 2024, Jessica responded to Stevenson, acknowledging receipt of the VA’s claim balance information and clarifying that their updated request was for any charges beyond the date of service. Jessica asked whether there were any additional bills beyond the June 17, 2023 date of service.

In an earlier thread from October 4, 2024, Stevenson had noted that the VA claim had been transmitted to Jessica’s office on February 22, 2024, and she provided an EC Fax status for that transmission. The transmission was described as delivered successfully, with the following technical specifics: Job/Fax ID 06c170bb-b740-43e8-b903-5d3a419f6f34, originating fax 14809071910, destination fax 15023649363, duration 436 seconds, total pages 11, and the submission time of February 22, 2024 at 11:58:06 EST, with delivery completed at 12:06:23 EST. The subject of that fax was "Claim Asserted - ATTY - Wilder-Hamilton."

On October 14, 2024, Jessica Bottorff sent a follow-up message confirming that she had reviewed Robin Wilder Hamilton’s medical records. She noted that the dates 06/17/2023, 06/29/2024, and an electronic consult (E-Consult) on 04/16/2024 appeared to be related to the matter, and that the firm would need billing documentation for those specific dates.

In sum, the VA claim for Robin Wilder-Hamilton was closed as of August 20, 2024 after Auto-Owners paid the claim, leaving a zero balance. The case remains closed unless additional related VA treatment is identified and a request to reopen is submitted. The Revenue Law Group advised that medical records are not provided by their office and must be requested directly from the Lexington VA Medical Center Release of Information; they supplied the address and relevant instructions. The parties discussed obtaining a copy of the bill beyond the date of service (with particular reference to 06/17/2023), and Jessica requested confirmation of whether there were any additional bills after that date. The October 2024 exchanges also included standard confidentiality and security notices, reminders to reference the GCLAWS number in correspondence, instructions about secure email practices, and notices about updated VA fax numbers and related resources. Finally, the correspondence included guidance on third-party billing through the VA, CHAMPVA billing procedures, and directions for veterans to access and download their own health records, with links to VA resources.

The subject line was “Claim Asserted - ATTY - Wilder-Hamilton,” with the submission timestamp of 02/22/2024 11:58:06 EST and a delivery timestamp of 02/22/2024 12:06:23 EST. Stevenson indicated she would request a review of the other two dates that had not yet been billed and, if those dates were billable, would arrange billing for them. The message included Stevenson’s contact details and the standard Department of Veterans Affairs Office of General Counsel and Revenue Law Group signature block, along with guidance and links for third-party billing and ChampVA billing, as well as notices about PII and privacy, and several VA resources (including My HealtheVet and Vets.gov). The email body repeatedly referenced changes to VA fax numbers and directed recipients to verify fax numbers via the VA’s public site.

Earlier correspondence in the chain shows additional discussion around related VA treatment dates. In an October 14, 2024 email, Jessica Bottorff of Whaley Law Firm wrote that, after reviewing the client’s medical records, the dates 06/17/2023, 06/29/2024, and an E-Consult on 04/16/2024 appeared to be related, and that billing would be needed for those dates. This message was sent in reply to a prior exchange from Louise Stevenson.

In an October 4, 2024 message, Stevenson stated that the VA claim had been sent to the office on 02/22/2024 and noted the fax delivery details (the same 06c170bb-b740-43e8-b903-5d3a419f6f34) and the associated submission/delivery times. Stevenson added that the case had been closed on 08/20/2024 when payment was issued to the VA; if Whaley Law was including more VA treatment in the case, they should provide the dates to reopen the matter for billing; otherwise, the case would remain closed.

Also on October 4, 2024, Jessica Bottorff acknowledged receipt of the VA bill but clarified that their updated request seeks billing only for dates beyond the originally billed date of service. Specifically, she asked whether there were any additional bills past the 06/17/2023 date of service and indicated that there were no additional bills beyond that date.

In a separate message from October 4, 2024, Stevenson reiterated that the VA’s claim had been sent on 02/22/2024 and again provided the ECFax delivery confirmation details. The same message reminded recipients that, unless dates to be billed are provided to reopen the case, it would remain closed.

Finally, in the later October 2024 exchange, Jessica Bottorff clarified that, beyond the 06/17/2023 date of service, the dates 06/29/2024 and the E-Consult on 04/16/2024 appeared to be related, and that billing was needed for those dates as well.

Throughout the correspondence, there is inclusion of standard privacy notices (Privileged and Confidential) and instructions to reference the GCLAWS number associated with the case in correspondence. The communications also include reminders that fax numbers and contact channels can change and point to VA resources for medical bills, records, and health portals. The entire thread reflects ongoing VA billing review efforts for the Wilder-Hamilton MVA case, with particular emphasis on ensuring that all related VA treatment dates are billed and that the case status (open or closed) is appropriately managed based on submitted dates.

 Hello, this is Chris Williams, I am calling from I am calling from Sea Harbor. Insurance about your client, Robin Wilder Hamilton. And so I wanted to see when we could have a conversation and, you know, discuss this a little bit and try to see where we are. I do not find an email address for you in the file, my email address. So I would like to see if you and I could have a conversation and if we could just get this resolved so that your client could get paid, I will try you back if you get a chance to call me Back or shoot me an email. __Summary of the call with Robin Wilder Hamilton MVA 6/15/2023 - Filevine Project Email Address__
From: Aaron Whaley [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com)
To: Justin Chumbley [Justin@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:Justin@whaleylawfirm.com), Robin Wilder Hamilton MVA 6/15/2023 - Filevine Project Email Address [RobinWilderHamiltonMVAZ3849886@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com](mailto:RobinWilderHamiltonMVAZ3849886@louisvilleaccidentlawyer.filevineapp.com), Aaron Whaley [agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com](mailto:agwhaley@whaleylawfirm.com)
Date: Mon Oct 27 2025 03:05:18 GMT-04:00

Hey Justin,

Below is the summary of my call with Robin Wilder Hamilton. We're missing a
lot of stuff, and that's just part and parcel to the VA. She's got multiple
other MRIs and she's being prescribed physical therapy that has she's had
that is not in the file.

Please reach out to her and get it best you can. We're going to need a
detailed log of all the treatments she's gotten, all the providers she's
seen, and we're going to need priors as well. And she says it's all through
the VA, so we'll have to hand hold the VA to get all this stuff to us.

Hi

Here's the summary of the call with Robin Wilder Hamilton MVA 6/15/2023 -
Filevine Project Email Address at 10/27 02:56 PM (UTC-04:00):

The conversation focused on discussing medical records and treatment
related to Robin Wilder's ongoing health issues following an accident. The
outcome included plans for further record collection and coordination with
the VA for reimbursement.

Recap

* Aaron Whaley confirmed that all medical bills for Robin Wilder have been
taken care of, and the VA will be reimbursed in full plus an additional
$7,500.
* Robin Wilder detailed their ongoing health issues, including shoulder
pain, migraines, and muscle spasms, exacerbated by a previous accident, and
mentioned they are receiving treatment through the VA's IPRP program.
* Aaron Whaley acknowledged the complexity of Robin Wilder's medical
records, noting that they will need to gather additional information from
various healthcare providers to ensure all records are accounted for.
* Robin Wilder mentioned they are currently using a cane and a rollator due
to hip issues that have worsened since the accident, and they have an
upcoming MRI scheduled for their migraines.

Tasks

* Aaron Whaley will have Justin contact Robin Wilder to gather detailed
information about their medical records and treatment providers.
* Robin Wilder is advised to compile and share their medical records with
the VA to facilitate the reimbursement process.

Best,
aaron whaley

Powered by RingCentral AI Assistant (visit
https://www.ringcentral.com/ringex/ai-assistant for more information).
